meanings.definition: To remove material that is considered improper or offensive from a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher bowdlerizes the story before reading it to the class.
meanings.sent2: The editor bowdlerizes the article to make it suitable for all readers.
meanings.sent3: The librarian bowdlerizes the book, making sure it is appropriate for young readers.
meanings.sent4: She bowdlerizes the movie, cutting out scenes that may offend some viewers.
meanings.sent5: The parent bowdlerizes the bedtime story, ensuring it is child-friendly.

meanings.definition: To censor or edit a work by removing or altering content.
meanings.sent1: The government bowdlerizes the documentary to control the information shared.
meanings.sent2: The publisher bowdlerizes the novel to comply with censorship laws.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly bowdlerizes his own jokes to keep them family-friendly.
meanings.sent4: She bowdlerizes the play, changing dialogues to suit the audience.
meanings.sent5: The editor bowdlerizes the magazine, ensuring it meets editorial guidelines.
